description: The night before a cross-country race, Sadie Bjornsen relaxes her muscles and works her brain. She hears the countdown timer — beep, beep, beep — and imagines herself as a bird flying up the hills.
title: How She Conquers the Cross-Country Course
title_page: How She Conquers the Cross-Country Course - Video - NYTimes.com
text: Imagine that you’re an Olympic athlete about to compete. How do you calm your nerves? In this series, we take you inside the minds of current and former Olympians as they visualize their dream performance.
